get.description: Endpoint that reports an aggregated boolean value describing the general health of the system.

200.description: The system health is successfully measured.

403.description: The health endpoint is disabled via configuration.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a credit transaction.
Initialise a transaction and book an amount. The creditor is the customer and the debitor is the merchant.
Credit transaction is always processed synchronously, 'channel' has to be MOTO.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body for creating a credit transaction.

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a debit.

The debit transaction is a initial transaction to create an order. It is directly booking the initialAmount (No capture needed to receive the funds).

There are 2 workflows to process an order: ASYNC and SYNC.

With SYNC payment methods the transaction will directly result in a SUCCESS or a negative status.

With ASYNC payment methods the transaction will result in a PENDING or a negative status. If the status of the transaction is in PENDING the response will contain a redirectUrl.

The merchant system needs to redirect the shopper to the redirectUrl. After the shopper completes the payment action the transaction status will change to SUCCESS or a negative status.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body for creating a debit.

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a preauth.

The preauth transaction is a initial transaction to create an order. It is not directly booking the initialAmount (A capture is needed to receive the funds).

There are 2 workflows to process an order: ASYNC and SYNC.

With SYNC payment methods the transaction will directly result in a OK/SUCCESS or a negative status.

With ASYNC payment methods the transaction will result in a PENDING or FAILURE/DECLINED/ABORTED status. If the status of the transaction is in PENDING the response will contain a redirectUrl.

The merchant system needs to redirect the shopper to the redirectUrl. After the shopper completes the payment action the transaction status will change to OK or a negative status.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body for creating a preauth.

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a refund on a debit or capture transaction.

A refund transaction can be applied on an existing debit or capture transaction in the status SUCCESS.

It can be used to refund the shopper with the given initialAmont.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: ID of the affected transaction. note: it must be a capture or a debit.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Response body for creating a refund.

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a capture on a preauth transaction.

A capture transaction can be applied on an existing and not expired preauth transaction in the status SUCCESS.

It can be used to capture the given initialAmount and can not be higher then the initialAmount of the given preauth transaction.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: ID of the affected transaction. note: it must be a preauth.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body for creating a capture.

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a cancel on a preauth transaction.

A cancel transaction can be applied on an existing and not expired preauth transaction in the status SUCCESS.

It can be used to cancel the given initialAmount and can not be higher then the initialAmount of the given preauth transaction.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: ID of the affected transaction. note: it must be a preauth.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body for creating a cancel

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

get.description: Endpoint to receive a specific transaction.

404.description: Not found casued by invalid input.

patch.description:
Endpoint to update a specific transaction.

Currently only available for non captured preauth transactions for the following payment methods: ratepay-invoice, ratepay-directdebit and ratepay-installment.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body for updating a transaction

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

404.description: Not found casued by invalid input.

Endpoint to get a specific order.

The  object represents an order and includes multiple transactions for different actions ( preauth, debit, capture, cancel, refund).

Dates

- terms

- privacy

- settlementDate

- createdAt

- modifiedAt

Numbers

- initialAmount

post.description:
Endpoint to create an order intent ( order with status CREATED)

An order with this status will not result in any charges, untill executed. The actual execution is done by some of the integration components (e.g. widget)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body to create a order intent.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a new customer.

A customer acts as a container for customer specific personas and addresses.

If the email address of the given customer is already known to the platform the API will respond with HTTP status 200 OK.

For every new created customer the platform will respond with the HTTP status 201 CREATED

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body to create a new customer.

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

get.description:
Endpoint to receive a specific paymentinstrument.

Payment instruments are objects representing the payment information used by the end customer.

A payment instrument can be created either explicitly ( creditcard & sepa via javascript bridge ) or implicitly with a debit or preauth transaction.

Depending on the type, payment instruments have different attributes, whereas some values will be masked to remain PCI conform ( e.g. creditcard number)

Payment instruments can be used for recurring payments, if the flag "recurring" is set to true.

Payment instruments are unique ( e.g. if a creditcard number is used twice, it will result in one payment instrument )

404.description: Not found casued by invalid input.

patch.description:
Endpoint to update the data associated with the specified paymentinstrument.

Also used to refresh the CVC of a creditcard payment instrument. In case of a recurring transaction the shopper can be forced to re-enter the verification code (cvc) - depends on the creditcard settings configuration.

Normally handled by the javascript bridge.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request object containing some or all of the updateable fields applicable for the type of the specified payment instrument. (CC or SEPA)

400.description: Bad request casued by invalid input.

delete.description: Endpoint to delete payment instrument with a given ID.

404.description: Not found casued by invalid input.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a new paymentinstrument.

Explicitly creating  payment instruments is possible for credit card and SEPA and should be done from the end customer's browser.

Call would normally be handled by the javascript bridge.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request body to create a new paymentinstrument.

400.description: Bad request based on invalid input.

get.description: The Configuration Request allows the merchant to read the stored configuration parameters for his merchant profile.
The Calculation Request calculates and returns an installment plan depending on the request parameters and the stored parameters of the merchant profile.
The Calculation Request calculates and returns an installment plan depending on the request parameters and the stored parameters of the merchant profile.

parameters.description: Contains the duration information of the installment plan

unitPrice.description: The unit price for this item excluding taxes. The unit amount should be given as smallest currency unit.

tax.description: The tax for this item. The tax should be given as smallest currency unit.

directDebitType.title: DirectDebitType
directDebitType.description:
The current mandate type of the direct debit type.
The mandate type can be one of the following.
FIRST: It's the first execution of the mandate SINGLE: It's used only for one execution of the mandate RECURRING: It's used for recurring mandate usage FINAL: It's the last execution of the recurring mandate
